mattress_rules: Mattresses are accepted for curbside bulk item collection. Residents must schedule collection by calling (512) 974-4343 or using the Austin 3-1-1 mobile app. Items must be placed at the curb by 6:30 a.m. on the scheduled collection day. Each household is allowed up to three bulk collections per year, with each collection limited to three cubic yards of items. Items should be easily handled by two people and not exceed 200 lbs. While general guidelines for bulk items state they should not exceed 6 feet long and 3 feet wide, mattresses are explicitly listed as an accepted item for bulk collection. No specific wrapping requirements for mattresses are stated.

dropoff_locations.name: Austin Resource Recovery Drop-Off Center
dropoff_locations.hours: Open 7 days a week, 9 a.m. - 5 p.m.

mattress_rules: Mattresses and box springs must be completely enclosed in a sealed plastic bag. If mattresses or box springs are not enclosed in a sealed plastic bag, DSNY will not collect them. Mattress bags can be purchased at most hardware or home improvement stores, or online. Residents can put out up to 6 bulk items per collection day with their regular trash on their designated collection days; no appointment is needed.

Los Angeles residents are eligible for up to four FREE bulky item collections each year, with up to 16 items collected per pick-up. Mattresses are included in bulky item collection. Mattresses and box springs must be wrapped in plastic for collection, per state law. Mattress bags can be purchased at most hardware stores and other retail outlets. To schedule a bulky item collection, call 1-800-773-2489 or use the MyLA311 app. Do not place items on the street more than 24 hours prior to your scheduled collection day. Make sure that items are placed where they are clearly visible and easily accessible for collection. Please place items 3 feet away from your bins to avoid blocking automated services.

dropoff_locations.name: Gaffey SAFE Center
dropoff_locations.address: 1400 N. Gaffey St., San Pedro, CA 90731

dropoff_locations.name: Glendale Hyperion SAFE Center
dropoff_locations.address: 4600 Los Feliz Blvd., Los Angeles, CA 90027

dropoff_locations.name: Nichols Canyon SAFE Center
dropoff_locations.address: 10601 W. Hollywood Way, Sun Valley, CA 91352

mattress_rules: The City of Chicago does not offer curbside collection for bulk items such as furniture or mattresses. Residents are responsible for arranging the proper disposal of these items. This may involve contacting a private waste hauling service, taking items to a private transfer station or recycling facility, or donating usable items to charity organizations.

Mattresses must be wrapped and sealed in plastic prior to collection or drop-off to prevent the spread of bed bugs. Heavy trash, which includes mattresses, is collected once a month on a scheduled basis. Residents must place heavy trash items at the curb no later than 6:00 a.m. on their scheduled heavy trash collection day, and not earlier than 6:00 p.m. the Friday before their collection week. Items for collection must be less than 8 feet in length and weigh less than 500 pounds, and placed at least 3 feet from obstructions such as mailboxes, fences, and utility poles.

dropoff_locations.name: Westpark Recycling Center and Neighborhood Depository

mattress_rules: Mattresses must be wrapped in plastic. The bulk trash pile can be up to 10 feet long, 5 feet wide and 5 feet high. Materials must be placed at the curb no earlier than one week prior to and no later than 5 a.m. on the scheduled collection day. Check your collection schedule on the City of Phoenix Public Works website for specific dates.

dropoff_locations.name: North Gateway Transfer Station
dropoff_locations.address: 30205 N Black Canyon Hwy, Phoenix, AZ 85085

mattress_rules: Mattresses and box springs are considered bulky items. They must be sealed in a plastic bag before being placed out for collection. There are no limits on the number of bulky items you can place out each week. Residents can put out bulky items with their regular trash and recycling on their collection day. No appointment is needed.

dropoff_locations.name: Northwest Philadelphia Sanitation Convenience Center
dropoff_locations.address: Domino Lane & Umbria St., Philadelphia, PA 19128

mattress_rules: Customers receive two (2) free bulk waste collections per year during their designated collection months. Any additional collections are subject to a fee. Mattresses and box springs must be completely wrapped and sealed in plastic to prevent the spread of bed bugs. Items must be placed on the curb/right-of-way in front of your home no earlier than 48 hours prior to your scheduled collection date, and no later than 6:00 a.m. on your collection day. Items must not exceed 8 cubic yards (the size of two small refrigerators). Schedule your collection by calling 311 or visiting sanantonio.gov/swmd to view your collection schedule.

Residential customers who receive City trash and recycling collection services can schedule free collection of large, bulky items, including mattresses. Customers are limited to four (4) bulky items per scheduled collection (e.g., one mattress and one box spring count as two items). Schedule a bulky item collection at least one day in advance; same-day collection is not available. All items must be placed at the curb (or in the alley) by 6 a.m. on your collection day, and not more than 24 hours in advance. Mattresses must be wrapped and sealed in plastic prior to collection to ensure the safety of collection crews and help prevent the spread of bed bugs.

dropoff_locations.name: Miramar Landfill Buyback Center
dropoff_locations.hours: Mon-Sat 7:30AM-4:30PM. Closed Sundays, New Year's Day, Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Day.

illegal_dumping_fine: Up to $10,000 and six months in jail or both. First offense littering/dumping fines range from $250 to $1,000, plus administrative fees.

mattress_rules: Mattresses and box springs must be completely sealed in a heavy-duty plastic bag or wrapped tightly in plastic sheeting. Place items at your front curb by 7 a.m. on the first day of your designated monthly collection week. Do not place items behind an obstruction or overhanging wire, or too close to your mailbox, gas meter, or other structures. There are no fees associated with this service.
